thread.title: Funny video: Bonnie Hunt wants Cubs tickets in this Second City sketch - Chicago Tribune
thread.title_full: Funny video: Bonnie Hunt wants Cubs tickets in this Second City sketch - Chicago Tribune

author: Morgan Greene
title: Funny video: Bonnie Hunt wants Cubs tickets in this Second City sketch - Chicago Tribune
text:
In this latest blast-from-the-past Second City sketch, Bonnie Hunt discovers the secret to getting Cubs tickets.
The sketch appeared in "Jean Paul Sartre and Ringo," the 1987 revue directed by Bernard Sahlins.
The cast included Steve Assad, Kevin Crowley, Aaron Freeman, Rick Hall, Bonnie Hunt and Barbara Wallace.
Crowley went on to appear in a number of films and television shows, including the baseball-themed "Major League." Hunt, a born-and-raised Chicagoan, has since starred in films including "Jumanji" and "The Green Mile."
The '87 season was another rough one for the Cubs, who finished 76-85.
In case you missed it, watch the latest video of the series featuring Dan Castellaneta, Bonnie Hunt and Richard Kind. Another Second City Cubs sketch is on-deck.
